result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN  to case 22CM1988 for the purpose of sentencing.

Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.

Defendant Joseph Fabian Chavez Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Joseph Fabian Chavez Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed Dr. Collins report and do not contest findings. State, defense and defendant waive right to hearing. Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  

Arguments heard as to bail. Court ordered $50.00 cash bail. Turnover to Justice Point LEVEL 3. All other previously ordered conditions remain. Case is adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Joseph Fabian Chavez in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Joseph Fabian Chavez in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph Fabian Chavez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk

Defendant Joseph Fabian Chavez in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Joseph Fabian Chavez in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph Fabian Chavez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.   Motion to challenge probable cause by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
